title.narrative: Forest Custodians protecting territories in the Brazilian Amazon

description.narrative:
1.1. Update of the diagnosis of pressure and threat vectors to the 14 Quilombola territories in Oriximiná and Óbidos - survey through satellite images of deforestation in and around the Quilombola lands, monitoring of farmland requests within traditional lands, mining processes; infrastructure megaprojects. 1.2. 8 Workshops for dissemination of monitoring results with community members of the areas monitored. 1.3. Planning meetings with 24 Quilombola leaders from the different communities for a joint protection agenda based on the monitoring results. 1.4. Production and dissemination of communication materials based on the results of the monitoring for Christian Aid and CPI-SP (our partner) audiences.
2.1. One exchange visit between indigenous and riverside leaders to a Quilombola community. The visit aims at: exposing the impacts of mining in Oriximiná and the risks of mining dams (the community to be visited is Boa Vista, which neighbors Ri

The project will be developed with Quilombola, indigenous and riverside communities in the municipalities of Oriximiná and Óbidos (Pará) with the overall objective of contributing to the protection of 8.9 million hectares of Amazon rainforest in northern Pará that make up the traditional territories of these peoples. It will a) Strengthen community-led capacities to identify local drivers of deforestation and depletion and promote systematic protection of the forest; b) Strengthen the joint response of indigenous, Quilombola and riverine people to the challenges facing the forest and their livelihoods
